2017 WW14 Purley Crystal Ridge BKC Release Announcement (BKC #5)

\n \n \n

DEG Platform Integration Team

\n \n
\n

The DEG platform Integration team announces the release of 2017 WW14 Purley Crystal Ridge BKC release package for Intel internal use. The release is based on OS of\n \n Fedora25\n server. The auto-installer packages are available in the Artifactory server (both SH site and OR site). Any questions please contact Bei, Ling.

\n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n
Auto InstallerSH Artifactory ServerOR Artifactory Server
Fedora25WithoutOS_BKC-CrystalRidge_FC24_69.117342.117338-2017WW14.zip\n \n
\\\\bkcfileserver.ccr.corp.intel.com\\pi_Internal\\Purley_BKC\\BKC_Package\\OS\\FC25.zip\n 		WithoutOS_BKC-CrystalRidge_FC24_69.117342.117338-2017WW14.zip\n \n
\\\\bkcfileserver.ccr.corp.intel.com\\pi_Internal\\Purley_BKC\\BKC_Package\\OS\\FC25.zip\n
\n

*Note: Please select the server which is closer to your region to get the better data accessing/downloading performance

\n\n
\n
\n   Summary \n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n \n \n \n \n \n \n
\n

 Test Result:

\xc2\xb7  Finish\nAEP test execution on Fedora25 (kernel is upgraded to 4.10.5-200 ) on 2-2-2 config\n(1LM/AppDirect and 2LM/Memory mode). Please visit HPQC for\ntest detail

\xc2\xb7  Refer\nto the installation guide BKC\npackage installation

\xc2\xb7   Total test case 21; Passed test case\nis: 19 and pass rate is 90% 

 

 Mandatory\nBIOS settings:

\xc2\xb7       EDKII menu -> Socket\nConfiguration -> Memory Configuration-> Attempt Fast Boot <disable>

\xc2\xb7       EDKII menu -> Socket\nConfiguration -> Memory Configuration-> Attempt Fast Boot Attempt\nFast Cold Boot <disable>

\xc2\xb7       EDKII menu -> Socket\nConfiguration -> Advanced\nPower Management Configuration -> Package\nC State Control/Package C State < C0/C1 state>

\xc2\xb7       EDKII menu -> Socket\nConfiguration -> UPI\nConfiguration -> UPI\nGeneral Configuration -> Directory\nMode Enable <Disable>

\xc2\xb7       EDKII menu -> Socket\nConfiguration -> Memory\nConfiguration -> Memory\nFrequency <2400>

\xc2\xb7       EDKII\nmenu -> Socket Configuration -> Memory Configuration -> NGN Configuration -> Publish ARS\ncapability <Disable>

ES1 AEP DIMM Setup BKM 

\xc2\xb7        Update CR FW

If AEP DIMM is not healthy, we have two alternatives:

a.      Do AEP format

           \n1. Attach ITP to the SKX XDP port

           \n2. On the ElkValley pythonSV console, type below commands for DIMM formatting

           \n>>>itp.cv.resetbreak=1

           \n>>> sv.refresh()

           \n>>> fw.showBSR()

      \n     >>>import falconvalley.fw.fnvFwFunctions\nas fw

           \n>>>fw.dfxFormat(unlockDimm=False)

           \n>>>itp.cv.resetbreak=0

           \n3. Power cycle the system

           \n4. Boot to UEFI shell and update CR

              \nApachePassCli.efi load -f \xe2\x80\x93source  .\\< _strip.bin fw file> -dimm


\n
\n

b.     If step a is\nnot working, use ITP/Jtag to update AEP FW and Syn SPD one by\none, follow the BKM Setup_TAB_AEP_BKM_v1.1.docx

 

If AEP DIMM is\nhealth, use UEFI shell to update all AEP FW

               ApachePassCli.efi\nload \xe2\x80\x93f -source <path_to_strip.bin> - dimm

 \xc2\xb7     Goal/namespace\ncan be created under UEFI or Linux

a.          UEFI:\nApachePassCli.efi create -f -goal PersistentMemoryType=AppDirect

                 ApachePassCli.efi\nshow -a \xe2\x80\x93pool

                 ApachePassCli.efi\ncreate \xe2\x80\x93namespace \xe2\x80\x93pool <pool_Id> Type=AppDirect

b.          Linux:\nixpdimm-cli create \xe2\x80\x93f \xe2\x80\x93goal persistentmemorytype=appdirect

                   ixpdimm- cli show -a\n\xe2\x80\x93pool

                   ixpdimm-cli create \xe2\x80\x93namespace \xe2\x80\x93pool <pool_Id>\nType=AppDirect

\n   HW Rework \n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n \n \n \n \n
\n

Pedigree and Board Jumper Settings: 2S Guide

Note: Only mandatory and necessary optional rework is implemented by BKC team

\xc2\xb7      2s

o NC_RWK_I (Mandatory): Update BMC FW

o NC_RWK_K (Mandatory): Avoiding false LAN Wake Activations

o NC_RWK_L (Mandatory): Update CPLD FW

o NC_RWK_M (Mandatory): No-Boot without ITP issue fix

o Note: In case you have implemented Optional rework 20, you should move switch S4E2.4 to OFF position, otherwise the default position is ON.

InformationQuick Guide
BKC Artifactory Access

Link (SH server): https://ubit-artifactory-sh.intel.com

Link (OR server): https://ubit-artifactory-or.intel.com

Steps for applying the permission:

  • Go to EAM website: https://eam.intel.com/EAMWeb/RequestAccess/DisplayTree.aspx?TopNode=757719
  • Apply for the "Project viewer" role
  • Use your windows credentials for authentication

BKC One Stop Shop

Link: https://dcg-oss.intel.com/homepage_view/24/

Steps for applying the permission:

  • Go to EAM website: https://eam.intel.com/EAMWeb/RequestAccess/DisplayTree.aspx?TopNode=829001
  • Navigate to:"BKC -- Purley"
  • Apply for the "User" or "Ingredient Owner" role
  • Use your windows credentials for authentication

Contact Person: Bei, Ling
